title: Bruno Bouchet shares time-saving refuelling trick that will save you 10 HOURS at the petrol pump
text:
A father who sparked outrage over his controversial rankings of chocolate bars and ice creams has shared an 'ingenious' time-saving trick for trips to the petrol station.

Bruno Bouchet, a former Kyle & Jackie O radio show producer, advised drivers to squeeze the pump trigger the second you step out of the car, instead of opening the fuel flap and unscrewing the cap.

Writing in an Instagram story, the Sydney father said this kick starts the flow of fuel while you tend to your car, saving half a day in wasted time over the course of a lifetime.

Sydney father Bruno Bouchet shared an ingenious tip to save you time at the petrol pump (stock image)

Mr Bouchet began by outlining the standard routine for filling a car with petrol.

'When refuelling, you normally open the fuel flap, unscrew the cap [and] grab the nozzle,' he said.

'Put the nozzle in the hole, squeeze the trigger and wait 10 seconds for the attendant to enable your pump.'

But Mr Bouchet said this approach is 'all wrong', before recommending his tried and tested time-saving routine.

Bruno Bouchet (pictured) said squeezing the petrol pump immediately after exiting the car will kick start the flow of fuel, saving you half a day in wasted time over the course of your life

'Give the trigger a quick squeeze the second you get out of the car, before even taking off the fuel cap.

'As soon as you squeeze the trigger again to pump fuel, it will have been enabled and you've saved yourself 10 seconds!'

Based on people who drive from the age of 17 to 85 and refuel once a week, Mr Bouchet said the nifty trick saves 10 hours over the course of a lifetime.

One follower messaged Mr Bouchet to say he had tried the tip, branding it 'epic'.

Mr Bouchet's followers were impressed with his nifty trick, branding the advice 'epic' (stock image)

It's not the first time Mr Bouchet has caused a stir on social media.

Last month, the rising social media personality shared a ranking of popular Australian chocolate bars, sparking outrage by leaving out classics like Cherry Ripe, Flake, Caramello and Cadbury Dairy Milk.

Controversially, Mr Bouchet crowned Picnic, Turkish Delight and Chomp as his 'God tier', followed by Snickers, Twix and Curly Wurly in the 'Royalty tier'.

In the centre of his rankings, Bruno listed KitKat, Crunchie and Mars in the 'Adam Sandler tier', or what he describes as 'take it or leave it' category.

In the second last tier titled 'Pleb', Bruno picked Twirl, Time Out and Aero.

Lastly, the 'would rather eat a bucket of cat vomit tier' included Violet Crumble, Milky Way, Chokito and Bounty.
description: An Australian father famed for sharing controversial rankings of food has revealed an ingenious tip for trips to the petrol station, which he says will save you half a day over a lifetime.
authors: Cindy Tran For Daily Mail Australia
